5547ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> PatchKernel::getCellVertexCoordinates(long id) const
5548{
5549 // Get the vertices ids
5550 const Cell &cell = getCell(id);
5551 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
5552 const int nCellVertices = cellVertexIds.size();
5553
5554 // Build the proxy vector with the coordinates
5555 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> vertexCoordinates(ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nCellVertices);
5556 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::storage_pointer storage = vertexCoordinates.storedData();
5557 getVertexCoords(cellVertexIds.size(), cellVertexIds.data(), storage);
5558
5559 return vertexCoordinates;
5560}

5574
5583void PatchKernel::getCellVertexCoordinates(long id, std::array<double, 3> *coordinates) const
5584{
5585 const Cell &cell = getCell(id);
5586
5587 getElementVertexCoordinates(cell, coordinates);
5588}
5589
5596std::array<double, 3> PatchKernel::evalInterfaceCentroid(long id) const
5597{
5598 const Interface &interface = getInterface(id);
5599
5600 return evalElementCentroid(interface);
5601}
5602
5610void PatchKernel::evalInterfaceBoundingBox(long id, std::array<double,3> *minPoint, std::array<double,3> *maxPoint) const
5611{
5612 const Interface &interface = getInterface(id);
5613
5614 evalElementBoundingBox(interface, minPoint, maxPoint);
5615}
5616
5623ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> PatchKernel::getInterfaceVertexCoordinates(long id) const
5624{
5625 // Get the vertices ids
5626 const Interface &interface = getInterface(id);
5627 ConstProxyVector<long> interfaceVertexIds = interface.getVertexIds();
5628 const int nInterfaceVertices = interfaceVertexIds.size();
5629
5630 // Build the proxy vector with the coordinates
5631 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> vertexCoordinates(ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nInterfaceVertices);
5632 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::storage_pointer storage = vertexCoordinates.storedData();
5633 getVertexCoords(interfaceVertexIds.size(), interfaceVertexIds.data(), storage);
5634
5635 return vertexCoordinates;
5636}
5637
5644void PatchKernel::getInterfaceVertexCoordinates(long id, std::unique_ptr<std::array<double, 3>[]> *coordinates) const
5645{
5646 const Interface &interface = getInterface(id);
5647
5648 getElementVertexCoordinates(interface, coordinates);
5649}
5650
5659void PatchKernel::getInterfaceVertexCoordinates(long id, std::array<double, 3> *coordinates) const
5660{
5661 const Interface &interface = getInterface(id);
5662
5663 getElementVertexCoordinates(interface, coordinates);
5664}
5665
5675std::array<double, 3> PatchKernel::evalElementCentroid(const Element &element) const
5676{
5677 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
5678 std::size_t nCellVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
5679 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(vertexCoordinates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nCellVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
5680 getVertexCoords(nCellVertices, elementVertexIds.data(), vertexCoordinates);
5681
5682 return element.evalCentroid(vertexCoordinates);
5683}
5684
5692void PatchKernel::evalElementBoundingBox(const Element &element, std::array<double,3> *minPoint, std::array<double,3> *maxPoint) const
5693{
5694 ElementType elementType = element.getType();
5695 switch (elementType)
5696 {
5697
5698 case ElementType::VERTEX:
5699 {
5700 const long *elementConnect = element.getConnect();
5701 *minPoint = getVertexCoords(elementConnect[0]);
5702 *maxPoint = *minPoint;
5703 break;
5704 }
5705
5706 case ElementType::PIXEL:
5707 {
5708 const long *elementConnect = element.getConnect();
5709
5710 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord_0 = getVertexCoords(elementConnect[0]);
5711 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord_3 = getVertexCoords(elementConnect[3]);
5712
5713 for (int d = 0; d < 3; ++d) {
5714 (*minPoint)[d] = std::min(vertexCoord_0[d], vertexCoord_3[d]);
5715 (*maxPoint)[d] = std::max(vertexCoord_0[d], vertexCoord_3[d]);
5716 }
5717
5718 break;
5719 }
5720
5721 case ElementType::VOXEL:
5722 {
5723 const long *elementConnect = element.getConnect();
5724
5725 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord_0 = getVertexCoords(elementConnect[0]);
5726 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord_7 = getVertexCoords(elementConnect[7]);
5727
5728 for (int d = 0; d < 3; ++d) {
5729 (*minPoint)[d] = std::min(vertexCoord_0[d], vertexCoord_7[d]);
5730 (*maxPoint)[d] = std::max(vertexCoord_0[d], vertexCoord_7[d]);
5731 }
5732
5733 break;
5734 }
5735
5736 default:
5737 {
5738 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
5739 const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
5740
5741 *minPoint = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[0]);
5742 *maxPoint = *minPoint;
5743 for (int i = 1; i < nElementVertices; ++i) {
5744 const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[i]);
5745 for (int d = 0; d < 3; ++d) {
5746 (*minPoint)[d] = std::min(vertexCoord[d], (*minPoint)[d]);
5747 (*maxPoint)[d] = std::max(vertexCoord[d], (*maxPoint)[d]);
5748 }
5749 }
5750
5751 break;
5752 }
5753
5754 }
5755}
5756
5769long PatchKernel::locatePoint(double x, double y, double z) const
5770{
5771 return locatePoint({{x, y, z}});
5772}
5773
5784bool PatchKernel::isSameFace(const Cell &cell_A, int face_A, const Cell &cell_B, int face_B) const
5785{
5786 if (cell_A.getFaceType(face_A) != cell_B.getFaceType(face_B)) {
5787 return false;
5788 }
5789
5790 int nFaceVertices = cell_A.getFaceVertexCount(face_A);
5791
5792 std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_A(nFaceVertices);
5793 std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_B(nFaceVertices);
5794 for (int k = 0; k < nFaceVertices; ++k) {
5795 faceVertexIds_A[k] = cell_A.getFaceVertexId(face_A, k);
5796 faceVertexIds_B[k] = cell_B.getFaceVertexId(face_B, k);
5797 }
5798
5799 std::sort(faceVertexIds_A.begin(), faceVertexIds_A.end());
5800 std::sort(faceVertexIds_B.begin(), faceVertexIds_B.end());
5801
5802 return (faceVertexIds_A == faceVertexIds_B);
5803}
5804
5810PatchKernel::AdjacenciesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() const
5811{
5812 return m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy;
5813}
5814
5820void PatchKernel::setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy status)
5821{
5822 m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy = status;
5823}
5824
5832bool PatchKernel::areAdjacenciesDirty(bool global) const
5833{
5834 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5835 return false;
5836 }
5837
5838 bool areDirty = false;
5839 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5840 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5841 if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5842 areDirty = true;
5843 break;
5844 }
5845 }
5846
5847#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
5848 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
5849 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
5850 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
5851 }
5852#else
5853 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
5854#endif
5855
5856 return areDirty;
5857}
5858
5865void PatchKernel::buildAdjacencies()
5866{
5867 initializeAdjacencies(ADJACENCIES_AUTOMATIC);
5868}
5869
5878void PatchKernel::initializeAdjacencies(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy strategy)
5879{
5880 // Get current build stategy
5881 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5882
5883 // Early return if we don't need adjacencies
5884 if (strategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5885 if (currentStrategy != ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5886 destroyAdjacencies();
5887 }
5888
5889 return;
5890 }
5891
5892 // Update the build strategy
5893 if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
5894 setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(strategy);
5895 }
5896
5897 // Reset adjacencies
5898 resetAdjacencies();
5899
5900 // Update the adjacencies
5901 updateAdjacencies();
5902}
5903
5910void PatchKernel::updateAdjacencies(bool forcedUpdated)
5911{
5912 // Early return if adjacencies are not built
5913 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5914 if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5915 return;
5916 }
5917
5918 // Check if the adjacencies are dirty
5919 bool adjacenciesDirty = areAdjacenciesDirty();
5920 if (!adjacenciesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
5921 return;
5922 }
5923
5924 // Update adjacencies
5925 if (adjacenciesDirty) {
5926 // Prune stale adjacencies
5927 pruneStaleAdjacencies();
5928
5929 // Update adjacencies
5930 _updateAdjacencies();
5931
5932 // Adjacencies are now updated
5933 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5934 } else {
5935 initializeAdjacencies(currentStrategy);
5936 }
5937}
5938
5945void PatchKernel::destroyAdjacencies()
5946{
5947 // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5948 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5949 return;
5950 }
5951
5952 // Destroy the adjacencies
5953 _resetAdjacencies(true);
5954
5955 // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
5956 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5957
5958 // Set adjacencies status
5959 setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(ADJACENCIES_NONE);
5960}
5961
5968void PatchKernel::resetAdjacencies()
5969{
5970 // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5971 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5972 return;
5973 }
5974
5975 // Reset adjacencies
5976 _resetAdjacencies(false);
5977
5978 // All cells have now dirty adjacencies
5979 setCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5980}
5981
5991void PatchKernel::_resetAdjacencies(bool release)
5992{
5993 for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
5994 cell.resetAdjacencies(!release);
5995 }
5996}
5997
6004void PatchKernel::pruneStaleAdjacencies()
6005{
6006 // Early return if adjacencies are not built
6007 AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
6008 if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
6009 return;
6010 }
6011
6012 // Remove stale adjacencies
6013 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6014 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6015 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
6016 continue;
6017 }
6018
6019 long cellId = entry.first;
6020 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6021 if (cell.getAdjacencyCount() == 0) {
6022 continue;
6023 }
6024
6025 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6026 for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
6027 long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
6028 int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
6029 for (int i = nFaceAdjacencies - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
6030 long adjacency = faceAdjacencies[i];
6031 if (!testCellAlterationFlags(adjacency, FLAG_DELETED)) {
6032 continue;
6033 }
6034
6035 cell.deleteAdjacency(face, i);
6036 }
6037 }
6038 }
6039}
6040
6049void PatchKernel::_updateAdjacencies()
6050{
6051 int dimension = getDimension();
6052
6053 // Check if multiple adjacencies are allowed
6054 //
6055 // On a three-dimensional patch each internal face is shared between two,
6056 // and only two, half-faces. On lower dimension patches one internal face
6057 // may be shared among multiple half-faces (this happens with non-manifold
6058 // patches).
6059 bool multipleMatchesAllowed = (dimension < 3);
6060
6061 // Define matching windings
6062 //
6063 // If faces can be shared only between two half-faces, there is a one-to-one
6064 // correspondence between the half-faces. Give one half-faces, its matching
6065 // can be found looking for an half-faces with the same vertices but with
6066 // reverse vertex winding order.
6067 //
6068 // If faces can be shared among more than two half-faces, it's not anymore
6069 // possible to define a unique winding order for the vertices of the faces.
6070 // There is no more a one-to-one correspondence between pairs of half-face.
6071 // In this case, when looking for half-face correspondence, it is necessary
6072 // to look for half-faces with reverse vertex winding order and also for
6073 // half-faces with the same vertex winding order.
6074 std::vector<CellHalfFace::Winding> matchingWindings;
6075 matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_REVERSE);
6076 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6077 matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
6078 }
6079
6080 // Count cells with dirty adjacencies
6081 long nDirtyAdjacenciesCells = 0;
6082 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6083 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6084 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
6085 continue;
6086 }
6087
6088 ++nDirtyAdjacenciesCells;
6089 }
6090
6091 // Get the vertices of cells with dirty adjacencies
6092 //
6093 // The list is only needed if multiple matches are allowed and there are
6094 // cells whose adjacencies don't need to be updated.
6095 std::unique_ptr<PiercedStorage<bool, long>> dirtyAdjacenciesVertices;
6096 if (multipleMatchesAllowed && (nDirtyAdjacenciesCells != getCellCount())) {
6097 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices = std::unique_ptr<PiercedStorage<bool, long>>(new PiercedStorage<bool, long>(1, &m_vertices));
6098 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->fill(false);
6099 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6100 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6101 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
6102 continue;
6103 }
6104
6105 long cellId = entry.first;
6106 const Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6107 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
6108 for (long vertexId : cellVertexIds) {
6109 dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->at(vertexId) = true;
6110 }
6111 }
6112 }
6113
6114 // List the cells that needs to be processed
6115 //
6116 // The list should contain the cells whose adjacencies need to be updated
6117 // and their neighbours candidates.
6118 //
6119 // Cells whose adjacencies needs to be updated are cells having the dirty
6120 // adjaceny flag set.
6121 //
6122 // Neighbours candidates are all border cells and, if multiple matches are
6123 // allowed, cells that share vertices with a cell with dirty adjacencies.
6124 std::vector<Cell *> processList;
6125 processList.reserve(nDirtyAdjacenciesCells);
6126
6127 std::size_t nMaxHalfFaces = 0;
6128 for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
6129 // Get cell information
6130 long cellId = cell.getId();
6131 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6132
6133 // Add cells with dirty adjacencies
6134 if (testCellAlterationFlags(cellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
6135 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
6136 processList.push_back(&cell);
6137 continue;
6138 }
6139
6140 // Add border cells
6141 bool isBorderCell = false;
6142 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
6143 if (cell.isFaceBorder(face)) {
6144 isBorderCell = true;
6145 continue;
6146 }
6147 }
6148
6149 if (isBorderCell) {
6150 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
6151 processList.push_back(&cell);
6152 continue;
6153 }
6154
6155 // Add cell that share vertices with a cell with dirty adjacencies
6156 //
6157 // For performace reasons, the check is a bit rough. All cells that
6158 // share a number of vertices at least equal to the dimension af the
6159 // patch will be added to the process list. This will add also cells
6160 // that are not neighbour candidates, but it's faster to add some false
6161 // positives, rather trying to filter them out.
6162 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6163 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
6164
6165 int nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices = 0;
6166 bool futureNeighbourCandidate = false;
6167 for (long vertexId : cellVertexIds) {
6168 if (dirtyAdjacenciesVertices->at(vertexId)) {
6169 ++nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices;
6170 if (nCelldirtyAdjacenciesVertices >= dimension) {
6171 futureNeighbourCandidate = true;
6172 break;
6173 }
6174 }
6175 }
6176
6177 if (futureNeighbourCandidate) {
6178 nMaxHalfFaces += nCellFaces;
6179 processList.push_back(&cell);
6180 }
6181 }
6182 }
6183
6184 // Create the adjacencies
6185 std::unordered_set<CellHalfFace, CellHalfFace::Hasher> halfFaces;
6186 halfFaces.reserve(static_cast<std::size_t>(0.5 * nMaxHalfFaces));
6187
6188 std::vector<std::pair<Cell *, int>> matchingAdjacencies;
6189 for (Cell *cell : processList) {
6190 long cellId = cell->getId();
6191 const int nCellFaces = cell->getFaceCount();
6192 bool areCellAdjacenciesDirty = testCellAlterationFlags(cellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
6193 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
6194 // Generate the half-face
6195 CellHalfFace halfFace(*cell, face);
6196
6197 // Find matching half-face
6198 auto matchingHalfFaceItr = halfFaces.end();
6199 for (CellHalfFace::Winding winding : matchingWindings) {
6200 // Set winding order
6201 halfFace.setWinding(winding);
6202
6203 // Search for matching half-face
6204 matchingHalfFaceItr = halfFaces.find(halfFace);
6205 if (matchingHalfFaceItr != halfFaces.end()) {
6206 break;
6207 }
6208 }
6209
6210 // Early return if no matching half-face has been found
6211 //
6212 // If no matching half-face has been found, we need to add the
6213 // current half-face to the list because it may match the face
6214 // of a cell that will be processed later.
6215 if (matchingHalfFaceItr == halfFaces.end()) {
6216 halfFace.setWinding(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
6217 halfFaces.insert(std::move(halfFace));
6218 continue;
6219 }
6220
6221 // Get matching half-face information
6222 const CellHalfFace &matchingHalfFace = *matchingHalfFaceItr;
6223 Cell &matchingCell = matchingHalfFace.getCell();
6224 long matchingCellId = matchingCell.getId();
6225 long matchingFace = matchingHalfFace.getFace();
6226
6227 // Only process cells with dirty adjacencies
6228 //
6229 // In order to limit the half faces that need to be stored, we are
6230 // processing at the same time cells with dirty adjacencies and
6231 // their neighbour candidates. This means we will also find matches
6232 // between faces of cell whose adjacensies are already up-to-date.
6233 bool areMatchingCellAdjacenciesDirty = testCellAlterationFlags(matchingCellId, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
6234 if (!areCellAdjacenciesDirty && !areMatchingCellAdjacenciesDirty) {
6235 continue;
6236 }
6237
6238 // Identifty matching adjacencies
6239 //
6240 // If multiple matches are allowed, in addition to the entry
6241 // related to the matching half face, we also need to add the
6242 // entries associated to the adjacencies already identified
6243 // for the half face.
6244 matchingAdjacencies.clear();
6245 matchingAdjacencies.emplace_back(std::make_pair<Cell *, int>(&matchingCell, matchingFace));
6246 if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6247 const int nMachingFaceNeighs = matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace);
6248 const long *machingFaceNeighs = matchingCell.getAdjacencies(matchingFace);
6249 for (int k = 0; k < nMachingFaceNeighs; ++k) {
6250 long neighId = machingFaceNeighs[k];
6251 if (neighId == cellId) {
6252 continue;
6253 }
6254
6255 Cell &neigh = m_cells.at(neighId);
6256 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(matchingCell, matchingFace, neigh);
6257 matchingAdjacencies.emplace_back(std::make_pair<Cell *, int>(&neigh, std::move(neighFace)));
6258 }
6259 } else {
6260 // When cell adjacencies are makred dirty this means that some
6261 // adjacencies are dirty not that all adjacencies are dirty.
6262 // The matchin cell may have no adjaceny associated to the
6263 // matching face or a signle adjacency that should match
6264 // the current cell.
6265 assert(matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace) == 0 || (matchingCell.getAdjacencyCount(matchingFace) == 1 && (*(matchingCell.getAdjacencies(matchingFace)) == cellId)));
6266 }
6267
6268 // Create adjacencies
6269 for (const std::pair<Cell *, int> &matchingAdjacency : matchingAdjacencies) {
6270 Cell *adjacentCell = matchingAdjacency.first;
6271 long adjacentCellId = adjacentCell->getId();
6272 int adjacentFace = matchingAdjacency.second;
6273
6274 cell->pushAdjacency(face, adjacentCellId);
6275 adjacentCell->pushAdjacency(adjacentFace, cellId);
6276 }
6277
6278 // Remove the matching half-face from the list
6279 //
6280 // If multiple matches are allowed, we need to keep the half
6281 // face, because that entry may match the face of a cell that
6282 // will be processed later.
6283 if (!multipleMatchesAllowed) {
6284 halfFaces.erase(matchingHalfFaceItr);
6285 }
6286 }
6287 }
6288}
6289
6295PatchKernel::InterfacesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getInterfacesBuildStrategy() const
6296{
6297 return m_interfacesBuildStrategy;
6298}
6299
6305void PatchKernel::setInterfacesBuildStrategy(InterfacesBuildStrategy status)
6306{
6307 if (status == INTERFACES_AUTOMATIC) {
6308 if (!isInterfaceAutoIndexingEnabled()) {
6309 throw std::runtime_error("Automatic build strategy requires auto-indexing.");
6310 }
6311 }
6312
6313 m_interfacesBuildStrategy = status;
6314}
6315
6323bool PatchKernel::areInterfacesDirty(bool global) const
6324{
6325 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6326 return false;
6327 }
6328
6329 bool areDirty = !m_alteredInterfaces.empty();
6330 if (!areDirty) {
6331 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6332 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6333 if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6334 areDirty = true;
6335 break;
6336 }
6337 }
6338 }
6339
6340#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6341 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6342 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
6343 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
6344 }
6345#else
6346 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6347#endif
6348
6349 return areDirty;
6350}
6351
6358void PatchKernel::buildInterfaces()
6359{
6360 initializeInterfaces(INTERFACES_AUTOMATIC);
6361}
6362
6374void PatchKernel::initializeInterfaces(InterfacesBuildStrategy strategy)
6375{
6376 // Interfaces need adjacencies
6377 if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
6378 throw std::runtime_error ("Adjacencies are mandatory for building the interfaces.");
6379 }
6380
6381 // Get current build stategy
6382 InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
6383
6384 // Early return if we don't need interfaces
6385 if (strategy == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6386 if (currentStrategy != INTERFACES_NONE) {
6387 destroyInterfaces();
6388 }
6389
6390 return;
6391 }
6392
6393 // Update the build strategy
6394 if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
6395 setInterfacesBuildStrategy(strategy);
6396 }
6397
6398 // Reset interfaces
6399 resetInterfaces();
6400
6401 // Update the interfaces
6402 updateInterfaces();
6403}
6404
6411void PatchKernel::updateInterfaces(bool forcedUpdated)
6412{
6413 // Early return if interfaces are not built
6414 InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
6415 if (currentStrategy == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6416 return;
6417 }
6418
6419 // Check if the interfaces are dirty
6420 bool interfacesDirty = areInterfacesDirty();
6421 if (!interfacesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
6422 return;
6423 }
6424
6425 // Interfaces need up-to-date adjacencies
6426 assert(getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() != ADJACENCIES_NONE);
6427 updateAdjacencies();
6428
6429 // Update interfaces
6430 if (interfacesDirty) {
6431 // Enable advanced editing
6432 bool originalExpertStatus = isExpert();
6433 setExpert(true);
6434
6435 // Prune stale interfaces
6436 pruneStaleInterfaces();
6437
6438 // Update interfaces
6439 _updateInterfaces();
6440
6441 // Interfaces are now updated
6442 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
6443 m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
6444
6445 // Set original advanced editing status
6446 setExpert(originalExpertStatus);
6447 } else {
6448 initializeInterfaces(currentStrategy);
6449 }
6450}
6451
6458void PatchKernel::destroyInterfaces()
6459{
6460 // Early return if no interfaces have been built
6461 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6462 return;
6463 }
6464
6465 // Destroy the interfaces
6466 _resetInterfaces(true);
6467
6468 // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
6469 unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
6470
6471 // Clear list of altered interfaces
6472 m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
6473
6474 // Set interface build strategy
6475 setInterfacesBuildStrategy(INTERFACES_NONE);
6476}
6477
6484void PatchKernel::pruneStaleInterfaces()
6485{
6486 // Early return if no interfaces have been built
6487 if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
6488 return;
6489 }
6490
6491 // Remove dangling interfaces from cells
6492 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6493 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6494 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6495 continue;
6496 }
6497
6498 long cellId = entry.first;
6499 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6500 if (cell.getInterfaceCount() == 0) {
6501 continue;
6502 }
6503
6504 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6505 for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
6506 long *faceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(face);
6507 int nFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
6508 for (int i = nFaceInterfaces - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
6509 long interfaceId = faceInterfaces[i];
6510 if (!testInterfaceAlterationFlags(interfaceId, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
6511 continue;
6512 }
6513
6514 // Delete the interface from the cell
6515 cell.deleteInterface(face, i);
6516 }
6517 }
6518 }
6519
6520 // Delete dangling interfaces
6521 std::vector<long> danglingInterfaces;
6522 danglingInterfaces.reserve(m_alteredInterfaces.size());
6523 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredInterfaces) {
6524 AlterationFlags interfaceAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6525 if (!testAlterationFlags(interfaceAlterationFlags, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
6526 continue;
6527 }
6528
6529 long interfaceId = entry.first;
6530 danglingInterfaces.push_back(interfaceId);
6531 }
6532 deleteInterfaces(danglingInterfaces);
6533}
6534
6541void PatchKernel::_updateInterfaces()
6542{
6543 //
6544 // Update interfaces
6545 //
6546 // Adjacencies and interfaces of a face are paired: the i-th face adjacency
6547 // corresponds to the i-th face interface. Moreover if we loop through the
6548 // adjacencies of a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always
6549 // listed first. This meas that, to update the interfaces, we can count the
6550 // interfaces already associated to a face and loop only on the adjacencies
6551 // which have an index past the one of the last interface.
6552 //
6553 // On border faces of internal cells we need to build an interface, also
6554 // if there are no adjacencies.
6555 for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
6556 AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
6557 if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
6558 continue;
6559 }
6560
6561 long cellId = entry.first;
6562 Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
6563 const int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6564 for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
6565 int nFaceInterfaces= cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
6566
6567 bool isFaceBorder = cell.isFaceBorder(face);
6568 if (!isFaceBorder) {
6569 // Find the range of adjacencies that need an interface
6570 int updateEnd = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
6571 int updateBegin = nFaceInterfaces;
6572 if (updateBegin == updateEnd) {
6573 continue;
6574 }
6575
6576 // Build an interface for every adjacency
6577 const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
6578 for (int k = updateBegin; k < updateEnd; ++k) {
6579 long neighId = faceAdjacencies[k];
6580 Cell *neigh = &m_cells[neighId];
6581
6582 int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(cell, face, *neigh);
6583
6584 buildCellInterface(&cell, face, neigh, neighFace);
6585 }
6586 } else if (nFaceInterfaces == 0) {
6587 // Internal borderes need an interface
6588 buildCellInterface(&cell, face, nullptr, -1);
6589 }
6590 }
6591 }
6592}
6593
6608PatchKernel::InterfaceIterator PatchKernel::buildCellInterface(Cell *cell_1, int face_1, Cell *cell_2, int face_2, long interfaceId)
6609{
6610 // Validate the input
6611 assert(cell_1);
6612 assert(face_1 >= 0);
6613
6614 if (cell_2) {
6615 assert(face_2 >= 0);
6616 } else {
6617 assert(face_2 < 0);
6618 }
6619
6620 // Get the id of the first cell
6621 long id_1 = cell_1->getId();
6622
6623 // Get the id of the second cell
6624 long id_2 = Cell::NULL_ID;
6625 if (cell_2) {
6626 id_2 = cell_2->getId();
6627 }
6628
6629 // Owner and neighbour of the interface
6630 //
6631 // The interface is owned by the cell that has only one adjacency, i.e.,
6632 // by the cell that owns the smallest of the two faces. If the faces
6633 // of both cells have the same size, the interface is owned by the cell
6634 // with the "lower fuzzy positioning". It is not necessary to have a
6635 // precise comparison, it's only necessary to define a repeatable order
6636 // between the two cells. It is therefore possible to use the "fuzzy"
6637 // cell comparison.
6638 bool cellOwnsInterface = true;
6639 if (cell_2) {
6640 if (cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) > 1) {
6641 cellOwnsInterface = false;
6642 } else if (cell_2->getAdjacencyCount(face_2) == 1) {
6643 assert(cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) == 1);
6644 cellOwnsInterface = CellFuzzyPositionLess(*this)(id_1, id_2);
6645 }
6646 }
6647
6648 Cell *intrOwner;
6649 Cell *intrNeigh;
6650 long intrOwnerId;
6651 long intrNeighId;
6652 int intrOwnerFace;
6653 int intrNeighFace;
6654 if (cellOwnsInterface) {
6655 intrOwnerId = id_1;
6656 intrOwner = cell_1;
6657 intrOwnerFace = face_1;
6658
6659 if (cell_2) {
6660 intrNeighId = id_2;
6661 intrNeigh = cell_2;
6662 intrNeighFace = face_2;
6663 } else {
6664 intrNeighId = Cell::NULL_ID;
6665 intrNeigh = nullptr;
6666 intrNeighFace = -1;
6667 }
6668 } else {
6669 intrOwnerId = id_2;
6670 intrOwner = cell_2;
6671 intrOwnerFace = face_2;
6672
6673 intrNeighId = id_1;
6674 intrNeigh = cell_1;
6675 intrNeighFace = face_1;
6676 }
6677
6678 // Connectivity of the interface
6679 ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = intrOwner->getFaceConnect(intrOwnerFace);
6680
6681 int nInterfaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
6682 std::unique_ptr<long[]> interfaceConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nInterfaceVertices]);
6683 for (int k = 0; k < nInterfaceVertices; ++k) {
6684 interfaceConnect[k] = faceConnect[k];
6685 }
6686
6687 // Create the interface
6688 Interface *interface;
6689 InterfaceIterator interfaceIterator;
6690
6691 ElementType interfaceType = intrOwner->getFaceType(intrOwnerFace);
6692 if (interfaceId < 0) {
6693 interfaceIterator = addInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
6694 interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
6695 interfaceId = interface->getId();
6696 } else {
6697 interfaceIterator = restoreInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
6698 interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
6699 }
6700
6701 // Set owner and neighbour
6702 interface->setOwner(intrOwnerId, intrOwnerFace);
6703 if (intrNeighId >= 0) {
6704 interface->setNeigh(intrNeighId, intrNeighFace);
6705 }
6706
6707 // Update owner and neighbour cell data
6708 //
6709 // Adjacencies and interfaces are paired: the i-th adjacency correspondes
6710 // to the i-th interface. Moreover if we loop through the adjacencies of
6711 // a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always listed first.
6712 // When the interfaces are fully built, each adjacency is associated to an
6713 // interface, however this will not be true during the generation of the
6714 // interfaces. If the adjacencies already associated to an interface are
6715 // listed first, it will be easy to detect which interfaces are still to
6716 // be built: the missing interfaces are associated to the adjacencies which
6717 // have an index past the last interface.
6718 //
6719 // The above only matters if the neighbour cell exists, if there is no
6720 // neighbour there will be only one interface on that face, so there are
6721 // no ordering issues.
6722 intrOwner->pushInterface(intrOwnerFace, interfaceId);
6723 if (intrNeigh) {
6724 intrNeigh->pushInterface(intrNeighFace, interfaceId);
6725
6726 // Fix adjacency order on the owner cell
6727 int ownerInterfaceIndex = intrOwner->getInterfaceCount(intrOwnerFace) - 1;
6728 long ownerPairedAdjacency = intrOwner->getAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex);
6729 if (ownerPairedAdjacency != intrNeighId) {
6730 int ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrOwner->findAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, intrNeighId);
6731 assert(ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
6732 intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex, intrNeighId);
6733 intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex, ownerPairedAdjacency);
6734 }
6735
6736 // Fix adjacency order on the neighbour cell
6737 int neighInterfaceIndex = intrNeigh->getInterfaceCount(intrNeighFace) - 1;
6738 long neighPairedAdjacency = intrNeigh->getAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex);
6739 if (neighPairedAdjacency != intrOwnerId) {
6740 int neighPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrNeigh->findAdjacency(intrNeighFace, intrOwnerId);
6741 assert(neighPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
6742 intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex, intrOwnerId);
6743 intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighPairedAdjacencyIndex, neighPairedAdjacency);
6744 }
6745 }
6746
6747 return interfaceIterator;
6748}
6749
6759int PatchKernel::findAdjoinNeighFace(const Cell &cell, int cellFace, const Cell &neigh) const
6760{
6761 // Evaluate list of candidate faces
6762 //
6763 // The cells may be neighbours through multiple faces. Identify which face
6764 // matches the target one is quite expensive. Moreover, if the cells are
6765 // neighbours through a single face (which is the common case), the check
6766 // is not needed at all. Therefore, first we identify all the faces through
6767 // which the two cells are neighbours and then, if and only if there are
6768 // multiple candidates, we identify the face that matches the target one.
6769 long cellId = cell.getId();
6770 const int nNeighFaces = neigh.getFaceCount();
6771
6772 int nCandidates = 0;
6773 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(candidates, std::array<int BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nNeighFaces, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_FACES);
6774 for (int neighFace = 0; neighFace < nNeighFaces; neighFace++) {
6775 int nFaceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencyCount(neighFace);
6776 const long *faceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencies(neighFace);
6777 for (int k = 0; k < nFaceAdjacencies; ++k) {
6778 long geussId = faceAdjacencies[k];
6779 if (geussId == cellId) {
6780 (*candidates)[nCandidates] = neighFace;
6781 ++nCandidates;
6782 break;
6783 }
6784 }
6785 }
6786
6787 // Select the face of the neighbour which adjoin the given face
6788 if (nCandidates == 1) {
6789 return (*candidates)[0];
6790 } else {
6791 for (int i = 0; i < nCandidates; ++i) {
6792 int candidateFace = (*candidates)[i];
6793 if (isSameFace(cell, cellFace, neigh, candidateFace)) {
6794 return candidateFace;
6795 }
6796 }
6797 }
6798
6799 return -1;
6800}

6968bool PatchKernel::testElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, const AlterationFlagsStorage &flagsStorage) const
6969{
6970 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage.find(id);
6971 if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage.end()) {
6972 return testAlterationFlags(storedFlagsItr->second, flags);
6973 } else {
6974 return testAlterationFlags(FLAG_NONE, flags);
6975 }

6986{

6997PatchKernel::AlterationFlags PatchKernel::getElementAlterationFlags(long id, const AlterationFlagsStorage &flagsStorage) const
6998{
6999 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage.find(id);
7000 if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage.end()) {
7001 return storedFlagsItr->second;
7002 } else {
7003 return FLAG_NONE;
7004 }

7006
7014void PatchKernel::resetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
7015{
7016 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
7017 flagsStorage->erase(id);
7018 } else {
7019 (*flagsStorage)[id] = flags;
7020 }
7021}
7022
7030void PatchKernel::setElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
7031{
7032 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
7033 return;
7034 }
7035
7036 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
7037 if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end()) {
7038 storedFlagsItr->second |= flags;
7039 } else {
7040 flagsStorage->insert({id, flags});
7041 }
7042}
7043
7050void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
7051{
7052 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
7053 return;
7054 }
7055
7056 for (auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->begin(); storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end();) {
7057 storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
7058 if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
7059 storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
7060 } else {
7061 ++storedFlagsItr;
7062 }
7063 }
7064}
7065
7073void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
7074{
7075 if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
7076 return;
7077 }
7078
7079 auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
7080 if (storedFlagsItr == flagsStorage->end()) {
7081 return;
7082 }
7083
7084 storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
7085 if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
7086 flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
7087 }
7088}

7095void PatchKernel::clearBoundingBox()
7096{
7097 for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
7098 m_boxMinPoint[k] = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
7099 m_boxMinCounter[k] = 0;
7100
7101 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = - std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
7102 m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 0;
7103 }
7104
7105 setBoundingBoxDirty(getCellCount() > 0);
7106}
7107
7116void PatchKernel::setBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, const std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint)
7117{
7118 m_boxMinPoint = minPoint;
7119 m_boxMaxPoint = maxPoint;
7120
7121 setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
7122}
7123
7130void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
7131{
7132 getBoundingBox(false, minPoint, maxPoint);
7133}
7134
7143void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(bool global, std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
7144{
7145 minPoint = m_boxMinPoint;
7146 maxPoint = m_boxMaxPoint;
7147
7148#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7149 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
7150 MPI_Comm communicator = getCommunicator();
7151 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, minPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MIN, communicator);
7152 MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, maxPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MAX, communicator);
7153 }
7154#else
7155 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
7156#endif
7157}
7158
7164bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxFrozen() const
7165{
7166 return m_boxFrozen;
7167}
7168
7179void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxFrozen(bool frozen)
7180{
7181 m_boxFrozen = frozen;
7182}
7183
7191bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxDirty(bool global) const
7192{
7193 bool isDirty = m_boxDirty;
7194#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7195 if (global && isPartitioned()) {
7196 const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
7197 MPI_Allreduce(const_cast<bool *>(&m_boxDirty), &isDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
7198 }
7199#else
7200 BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
7201#endif
7202
7203 return isDirty;
7204}
7205
7211void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxDirty(bool dirty)
7212{
7213 m_boxDirty = dirty;
7214}
7215
7222void PatchKernel::updateBoundingBox(bool forcedUpdated)
7223{
7224 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen()) {
7225 return;
7226 }
7227
7228 // Check if the bounding box is dirty
7229 if (!isBoundingBoxDirty() && !forcedUpdated) {
7230 return;
7231 }
7232
7233 // Initialize bounding box
7234 clearBoundingBox();
7235
7236 // Unset the dirty flag in order to be able to update the bounding box
7237 setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
7238
7239 // Compute bounding box
7240 for (const auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7241 addPointToBoundingBox(vertex.getCoords());
7242 }
7243}
7244
7253void PatchKernel::addPointToBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
7254{
7255 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7256 return;
7257 }
7258
7259 for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
7260 double value = point[k];
7261
7262 // Update maximum value
7263 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], getTol())) {
7264 ++m_boxMaxCounter[k];
7265 } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
7266 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = value;
7267 m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 1;
7268 }
7269
7270 // Update minimum value
7271 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], getTol())) {
7272 ++m_boxMinCounter[k];
7273 } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
7274 m_boxMinPoint[k] = value;
7275 m_boxMinCounter[k] = 1;
7276 }
7277 }
7278}
7279
7288void PatchKernel::removePointFromBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
7289{
7290 if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7291 return;
7292 }
7293
7294 double tolerance = getTol();
7295 for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
7296 double value = point[k];
7297
7298 // Check if maximum value is still valid
7299 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], tolerance)) {
7300 --m_boxMaxCounter[k];
7301 if (m_boxMaxCounter[k] == 0) {
7302 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7303 return;
7304 }
7305 } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
7306 assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
7307 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7308 return;
7309 }
7310
7311 // Update minimum value
7312 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], tolerance)) {
7313 --m_boxMinCounter[k];
7314 if (m_boxMinCounter[k] == 0) {
7315 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7316 return;
7317 }
7318 } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
7319 assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
7320 setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
7321 return;
7322 }
7323 }
7324}
7325
7332ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> PatchKernel::getElementVertexCoordinates(const Element &element) const
7333{
7334 // Get the vertices ids
7335 ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
7336 const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
7337
7338 // Build the proxy vector with the coordinates
7339 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> vertexCoordinates(ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::INTERNAL_STORAGE, nElementVertices);
7340 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>>::storage_pointer storage = vertexCoordinates.storedData();
7341 getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds.size(), elementVertexIds.data(), storage);
7342
7343 return vertexCoordinates;
7344}

7378std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(int nBins)
7379{
7380 return PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(m_vertices, nBins);
7381}
7382
7390std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(const PiercedVector<Vertex> &vertices, int nBins)
7391{
7392 // Update bounding box
7393 updateBoundingBox();
7394
7395 // Bin's spacing
7396 double dx = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / ((double) nBins);
7397 double dy = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / ((double) nBins);
7398 double dz = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / ((double) nBins);
7399
7400 // Identify bins of vertices
7401 std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> bins;
7402 for (const Vertex &vertex : vertices) {
7403 const std::array<double, 3> &coordinates = vertex.getCoords();
7404
7405 int i = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / dx));
7406 int j = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / dy));
7407 int k = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / dz));
7408
7409 long binId = nBins * nBins * k + nBins * j + i;
7410 bins[binId].emplace_back(vertex.getId());
7411 }
7412
7413 return bins;
7414}
7415
7421void PatchKernel::translate(const std::array<double, 3> &translation)
7422{
7423 // Translate the patch
7424 for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7425 vertex.translate(translation);
7426 }
7427
7428 // Update the bounding box
7429 if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7430 m_boxMinPoint += translation;
7431 m_boxMaxPoint += translation;
7432 }
7433}
7434
7442void PatchKernel::translate(double sx, double sy, double sz)
7443{
7444 translate({{sx, sy, sz}});
7445}
7446
7455void PatchKernel::rotate(const std::array<double, 3> &n0, const std::array<double, 3> &n1, double angle)
7456{
7457 // Translate the patch
7458 for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7459 vertex.rotate(n0, n1, angle);
7460 }
7461
7462 // Update the bounding box
7463 if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() && !isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7464 // Save current bounding box
7465 std::array<std::array<double, 3>, 3> originalBox = {{m_boxMinPoint, m_boxMaxPoint}};
7466
7467 // Clear bounding box
7468 clearBoundingBox();
7469
7470 // Unset the dirty flag in order to be able to update the bounding box
7471 setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
7472
7473 // Evaluate rotated bounding box
7474 for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
7475 double xCorner = originalBox[i][0];
7476 for (int j = 0; j < 2; ++j) {
7477 double yCorner = originalBox[j][1];
7478 for (int k = 0; k < 2; ++k) {
7479 double zCorner = originalBox[k][2];
7480
7481 std::array<double, 3> corner = {{xCorner, yCorner, zCorner}};
7482 corner = CGElem::rotatePoint(corner, n0, n1, angle);
7483 addPointToBoundingBox(corner);
7484 }
7485 }
7486 }
7487 }
7488}
7489
7502void PatchKernel::rotate(double n0x, double n0y, double n0z, double n1x,
7503 double n1y, double n1z, double angle)
7504{
7505 rotate({{n0x, n0y, n0z}}, {{n1x, n1y, n1z}}, angle);
7506}

7515void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling)
7516{
7517 scale(scaling, m_boxMinPoint);
7518}
7519
7526void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
7527{
7528 // Scale the patch
7529 for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
7530 vertex.scale(scaling, center);
7531 }
7532
7533 // Update the bounding box
7534 if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
7535 for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
7536 m_boxMinPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMinPoint[k] - center[k]);
7537 m_boxMaxPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMaxPoint[k] - center[k]);
7538 }
7539 }
7540}
7541

7551 scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, m_boxMinPoint);
7552}

7562 scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, center);
7563}

7574 scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, m_boxMinPoint);
7575}
7576
7587void PatchKernel::scale(double sx, double sy, double sz, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
7588{
7589 scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, center);
7590}

7662
7671void PatchKernel::extractEnvelope(PatchKernel &envelope) const
7672{
7673
7674 // ====================================================================== //
7675 // RESIZE DATA STRUCTURES //
7676 // ====================================================================== //
7677 envelope.reserveVertices(envelope.getVertexCount() + countBorderVertices());
7678 envelope.reserveCells(envelope.getCellCount() + countBorderFaces());
7679
7680 // ====================================================================== //
7681 // LOOP OVER CELLS //
7682 // ====================================================================== //
7683 std::unordered_map<long, long> vertexMap;
7684 for (const Cell &cell : m_cells) {
7685 int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
7686 for (int i = 0; i < nCellFaces; ++i) {
7687 if (!cell.isFaceBorder(i)) {
7688 continue;
7689 }
7690
7691 // Add face vertices to the envelope and get face
7692 // connectivity in the envelope
7693 ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = cell.getFaceConnect(i);
7694 int nFaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
7695
7696 std::unique_ptr<long[]> faceEnvelopeConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nFaceVertices]);
7697 for (int j = 0; j < nFaceVertices; ++j) {
7698 long vertexId = faceConnect[j];
7699
7700 // If the vertex is not yet in the envelope
7701 // add it.
7702 if (vertexMap.count(vertexId) == 0) {
7703 const Vertex &vertex = getVertex(vertexId);
7704 VertexIterator envelopeVertex = envelope.addVertex(vertex);
7705 vertexMap[vertexId] = envelopeVertex->getId();
7706 }
7707
7708 // Update face ace connectivity in the envelope
7709 faceEnvelopeConnect[j] = vertexMap.at(vertexId);
7710 }
7711
7712 // Add face to envelope
7713 ElementType faceType = cell.getFaceType(i);
7714 envelope.addCell(faceType, std::move(faceEnvelopeConnect));
7715 }
7716 }
7717}

7726void PatchKernel::displayTopologyStats(std::ostream &out, unsigned int padding) const
7727{
7728 std::string indent = std::string(padding, ' ');
7729
7730 // ====================================================================== //
7731 // VERTEX STATS //
7732 // ====================================================================== //
7733 out << indent<< "Vertices --------------------------------" << std::endl;
7734 out << indent<< " # vertices " << getVertexCount() << std::endl;
7735 out << indent<< " # orphan vertices " << countOrphanVertices() << std::endl;
7736 out << indent<< " # border vertices " << countBorderVertices() << std::endl;
7737 //out << indent<< " # free vertices " << countDoubleVertices() << std::endl;
7738
7739 // ====================================================================== //
7740 // FACE STATS //
7741 // ====================================================================== //
7742 out << indent<< "Faces -----------------------------------" << std::endl;
7743 out << indent<< " # faces " << countFaces() << std::endl;
7744 out << indent<< " # border faces " << countBorderFaces() << std::endl;
7745
7746 // ====================================================================== //
7747 // CELLS STATS //
7748 // ====================================================================== //
7749 out << indent<< "Cells -----------------------------------" << std::endl;
7750 out << indent<< " # cells " << getCellCount() << std::endl;
7751 out << indent<< " # orphan cells " << countOrphanCells() << std::endl;
7752 out << indent<< " # border cells " << countBorderCells() << std::endl;
7753 //out << indent<< " # free vertices " << countDoubleCells() << std::endl;
7754}

7851
7858void PatchKernel::replaceVTKStreamer(const VTKBaseStreamer *original, VTKBaseStreamer *updated)
7859{
7860 // Update the VTK streamer
7861 //
7862 // The pointer to VTK streamers are copied, if there are pointer to the
7863 // original object they have to be replace with a pointer to this object.
7864 // Geometry fields
7865 std::vector<std::string> streamedGeomFields;
7866 streamedGeomFields.reserve(m_vtk.getGeomDataCount());
7867 for (auto itr = m_vtk.getGeomDataBegin(); itr != m_vtk.getGeomDataEnd(); ++itr) {
7868 const VTKField &field = *itr;
7869 if (&field.getStreamer() != original) {
7870 continue;
7871 }
7872
7873 streamedGeomFields.push_back(field.getName());
7874 }
7875
7876 for (const std::string &name : streamedGeomFields) {
7877 const VTKField &field = *(m_vtk.findGeomData(name));
7878 VTKField updatedField(field);
7879 updatedField.setStreamer(*updated);
7880
7881 m_vtk.setGeomData(std::move(updatedField));
7882 }
7883
7884 std::vector<std::string> streamedDataFields;
7885 streamedDataFields.reserve(m_vtk.getDataCount());
7886 for (auto itr = m_vtk.getDataBegin(); itr != m_vtk.getDataEnd(); ++itr) {
7887 const VTKField &field = *itr;
7888 if (&field.getStreamer() != original) {
7889 continue;
7890 }
7891
7892 streamedDataFields.push_back(field.getName());
7893 }
7894
7895 for (const std::string &name : streamedDataFields) {
7896 const VTKField &field = *(m_vtk.findData(name));
7897 VTKField updatedField(field);
7898 updatedField.setStreamer(*updated);
7899
7900 m_vtk.removeData(field.getName());
7901 m_vtk.addData(std::move(updatedField));
7902 }
7903}
7904
7915void PatchKernel::flushData(std::fstream &stream, const std::string &name, VTKFormat format)
7916{
7917 if (name == "Points") {
7918 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
7919 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
7920 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
7921 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7922 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
7923 const Vertex &vertex = m_vertices.rawAt(vertexRawId);
7924 flushValue(stream, format,vertex.getCoords());
7925 }
7926 }
7927 } else if (name == "offsets") {
7928 long offset = 0;
7929 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7930 offset += cell.getVertexCount();
7931 flushValue(stream, format,offset);
7932 }
7933 } else if (name == "types") {
7934 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7935 VTKElementType VTKType;
7936 switch (cell.getType()) {
7937
7938 case ElementType::VERTEX:
7939 VTKType = VTKElementType::VERTEX;
7940 break;
7941
7942 case ElementType::LINE:
7943 VTKType = VTKElementType::LINE;
7944 break;
7945
7946 case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
7947 VTKType = VTKElementType::TRIANGLE;
7948 break;
7949
7950 case ElementType::PIXEL:
7951 VTKType = VTKElementType::PIXEL;
7952 break;
7953
7954 case ElementType::QUAD:
7955 VTKType = VTKElementType::QUAD;
7956 break;
7957
7958 case ElementType::POLYGON:
7959 VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYGON;
7960 break;
7961
7962 case ElementType::TETRA:
7963 VTKType = VTKElementType::TETRA;
7964 break;
7965
7966 case ElementType::VOXEL:
7967 VTKType = VTKElementType::VOXEL;
7968 break;
7969
7970 case ElementType::HEXAHEDRON:
7971 VTKType = VTKElementType::HEXAHEDRON;
7972 break;
7973
7974 case ElementType::WEDGE:
7975 VTKType = VTKElementType::WEDGE;
7976 break;
7977
7978 case ElementType::PYRAMID:
7979 VTKType = VTKElementType::PYRAMID;
7980 break;
7981
7982 case ElementType::POLYHEDRON:
7983 VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYHEDRON;
7984 break;
7985
7986 default:
7987 VTKType = VTKElementType::UNDEFINED;
7988 break;
7989
7990 }
7991
7992 flushValue(stream, format,(int) VTKType);
7993 }
7994 } else if (name == "connectivity") {
7995 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
7996 ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
7997 const int nCellVertices = cellVertexIds.size();
7998 for (int k = 0; k < nCellVertices; ++k) {
7999 long vertexId = cellVertexIds[k];
8000 long vtkVertexId = m_vtkVertexMap.at(vertexId);
8001 flushValue(stream, format,vtkVertexId);
8002 }
8003 }
8004 } else if (name == "faces") {
8005 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8006 if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
8007 flushValue(stream, format,(long) 0);
8008 } else {
8009 std::vector<long> faceStream = cell.getFaceStream();
8010 Cell::renumberFaceStream(m_vtkVertexMap, &faceStream);
8011 int faceStreamSize = faceStream.size();
8012 for (int k = 0; k < faceStreamSize; ++k) {
8013 flushValue(stream, format,faceStream[k]);
8014 }
8015 }
8016 }
8017 } else if (name == "faceoffsets") {
8018 long offset = 0;
8019 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8020 if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
8021 offset += 1;
8022 } else {
8023 offset += cell.getFaceStreamSize();
8024 }
8025
8026 flushValue(stream, format,offset);
8027 }
8028 } else if (name == "cellIndex") {
8029 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8030 flushValue(stream, format,cell.getId());
8031 }
8032 } else if (name == "PID") {
8033 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8034 flushValue(stream, format,cell.getPID());
8035 }
8036 } else if (name == "vertexIndex") {
8037 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
8038 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
8039 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
8040 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
8041 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
8042 long vertexId = itr.getId();
8043 flushValue(stream, format,vertexId);
8044 }
8045 }
8046#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8047 } else if (name == "cellGlobalIndex") {
8048 PatchNumberingInfo numberingInfo(this);
8049 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8050 flushValue(stream, format,numberingInfo.getCellGlobalId(cell.getId()));
8051 }
8052 } else if (name == "cellRank") {
8053 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8054 flushValue(stream, format,getCellOwner(cell.getId()));
8055 }
8056 } else if (name == "cellHaloLayer") {
8057 for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
8058 flushValue(stream, format,getCellHaloLayer(cell.getId()));
8059 }
8060 } else if (name == "vertexRank") {
8061 VertexConstIterator endItr = vertexConstEnd();
8062 for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != endItr; ++itr) {
8063 std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
8064 long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
8065 if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
8066 flushValue(stream, format,getVertexOwner(itr.getId()));
8067 }
8068 }
8069#endif
8070 }
8071}
8072
8078void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberVertices(long offset)
8079{
8080 // Renumber vertices
8081 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_vertices, offset);
8082
8083 // Renumber cell connectivity
8084 for(Cell &cell : m_cells) {
8085 cell.renumberVertices(map);
8086 }
8087
8088 // Renumber interface connectivity
8089 for(Interface &interface : getInterfaces()) {
8090 interface.renumberVertices(map);
8091 }
8092
8093 // Reset index generator
8094 if (isVertexAutoIndexingEnabled()) {
8095 createVertexIndexGenerator(true);
8096 }
8097}
8098
8104void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberCells(long offset)
8105{
8106 // Renumber cells
8107 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_cells, offset);
8108
8109 // Renumber cell adjacencies
8110 for (auto &cell: m_cells) {
8111 long *adjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies();
8112 int nCellAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount();
8113 for (int i = 0; i < nCellAdjacencies; ++i) {
8114 long &neighId = adjacencies[i];
8115 neighId = map[neighId];
8116 }
8117 }
8118
8119 // Renumber interface owner and neighbour
8120 for (Interface &interface: m_interfaces) {
8121 long ownerId = interface.getOwner();
8122 int ownerFace = interface.getOwnerFace();
8123 interface.setOwner(map.at(ownerId), ownerFace);
8124
8125 long neighId = interface.getNeigh();
8126 if (neighId >= 0) {
8127 int neighFace = interface.getNeighFace();
8128 interface.setNeigh(map.at(neighId), neighFace);
8129 }
8130 }
8131
8132 // Renumber last internal and first ghost markers
8133 if (m_lastInternalCellId >= 0) {
8134 m_lastInternalCellId = map.at(m_lastInternalCellId);
8135 }
8136
8137#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8138 if (m_firstGhostCellId >= 0) {
8139 m_firstGhostCellId = map.at(m_firstGhostCellId);
8140 }
8141#endif
8142
8143 // Reset index generator
8144 if (isCellAutoIndexingEnabled()) {
8145 createCellIndexGenerator(true);
8146 }
8147
8148#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8149 // Update partitioning information
8150 if (isPartitioned()) {
8151 updatePartitioningInfo(true);
8152 }
8153#endif
8154}
8155
8161void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(long offset)
8162{
8163 // Renumber interfaces
8164 std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_interfaces, offset);
8165
8166 // Renumber cell interfaces
8167 for (Cell &cell: m_cells) {
8168 long *interfaces = cell.getInterfaces();
8169 int nCellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount();
8170 for (int i = 0; i < nCellInterfaces; ++i) {
8171 long &interfaceId = interfaces[i];
8172 interfaceId = map.at(interfaceId);
8173 }
8174 }
8175
8176 // Reset index generator
8177 if (isInterfaceAutoIndexingEnabled()) {
8178 createInterfaceIndexGenerator(true);
8179 }
8180}
8181
8190void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumber(long vertexOffset, long cellOffset, long interfaceOffset)
8191{
8192 consecutiveRenumberVertices(vertexOffset);
8193 consecutiveRenumberCells(cellOffset);
8194 consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(interfaceOffset);
8195}

8202int PatchKernel::getDumpVersion() const
8203{
8204 const int KERNEL_DUMP_VERSION = 12;
8205
8206 return (KERNEL_DUMP_VERSION + _getDumpVersion());
8207}
8208
8218bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream)
8219{
8220 // Update the patch
8221 update();
8222
8223 // Dump the patch
8224 const PatchKernel *constPatch = this;
8225 return constPatch->dump(stream);
8226}
8227
8239bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream) const
8240{
8241 // Dumping a dirty patch is not supported.
8242 bool dirty = isDirty(true);
8243 assert(!dirty && "Dumping a patch that is not up-to-date is not supported.");
8244 if (dirty) {
8245 return false;
8246 }
8247
8248 // Version
8249 utils::binary::write(stream, getDumpVersion());
8250
8251 // Generic information
8252 utils::binary::write(stream, m_id);
8253 utils::binary::write(stream, m_dimension);
8254 utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtk.getName());
8255#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8256 utils::binary::write(stream, m_haloSize);
8257#else
8258 utils::binary::write(stream, 0);
8259#endif
8260
8261 // Spawn status
8262 utils::binary::write(stream, m_spawnStatus);
8263
8264 // Adaption status
8265 utils::binary::write(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
8266
8267 // Partition status
8268#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8269 utils::binary::write(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
8270#else
8271 utils::binary::write(stream, PARTITIONING_UNSUPPORTED);
8272#endif
8273
8274 // Adjacencies build strategy
8275 utils::binary::write(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
8276
8277 // Dump interfaces build strategy
8278 utils::binary::write(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
8279
8280 // VTK data
8281 utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
8282
8283 // Specific dump
8284 _dump(stream);
8285
8286 // Geometric tolerance
8287 utils::binary::write(stream, (int) m_toleranceCustom);
8288 if (m_toleranceCustom) {
8289 utils::binary::write(stream, m_tolerance);
8290 }
8291
8292 // Index generators
8293 bool hasVertexAutoIndexing = isVertexAutoIndexingEnabled();
8294 utils::binary::write(stream, hasVertexAutoIndexing);
8295 if (hasVertexAutoIndexing) {
8296 dumpVertexAutoIndexing(stream);
8297 }
8298
8299 bool hasInterfaceAutoIndexing = isInterfaceAutoIndexingEnabled();
8300 utils::binary::write(stream, hasInterfaceAutoIndexing);
8301 if (hasInterfaceAutoIndexing) {
8302 dumpInterfaceAutoIndexing(stream);
8303 }
8304
8305 bool hasCellAutoIndexing = isCellAutoIndexingEnabled();
8306 utils::binary::write(stream, hasCellAutoIndexing);
8307 if (hasCellAutoIndexing) {
8308 dumpCellAutoIndexing(stream);
8309 }
8310
8311 // The patch has been dumped successfully
8312 return true;
8313}
8314
8322void PatchKernel::restore(std::istream &stream, bool reregister)
8323{
8324 // Reset the patch
8325 reset();
8326
8327 // Version
8328 int version;
8329 utils::binary::read(stream, version);
8330 if (version != getDumpVersion()) {
8331 throw std::runtime_error ("The version of the file does not match the required version");
8332 }
8333
8334 // Id
8335 int id;
8336 utils::binary::read(stream, id);
8337 if (reregister) {
8338 setId(id);
8339 }
8340
8341 // Dimension
8342 int dimension;
8343 utils::binary::read(stream, dimension);
8344 setDimension(dimension);
8345
8346 // Name
8347 std::string name;
8348 utils::binary::read(stream, name);
8349 m_vtk.setName(name);
8350
8351 // Halo size
8352#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8353 utils::binary::read(stream, m_haloSize);
8354#else
8355 int dummyHaloSize;
8356 utils::binary::read(stream, dummyHaloSize);
8357#endif
8358
8359 // Spawn status
8360 utils::binary::read(stream, m_spawnStatus);
8361
8362 // Adaption status
8363 utils::binary::read(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
8364
8365 // Partition status
8366#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8367 utils::binary::read(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
8368#else
8369 PartitioningStatus dummyPartitioningStatus;
8370 utils::binary::read(stream, dummyPartitioningStatus);
8371#endif
8372
8373 // Adjacencies build strategy
8374 utils::binary::read(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
8375
8376 // Interfaces build strategy
8377 utils::binary::read(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
8378
8379 // VTK data
8380 utils::binary::read(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
8381
8382 // Specific restore
8383 _restore(stream);
8384
8385#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
8386 // Update partitioning information
8387 if (isPartitioned()) {
8388 updatePartitioningInfo(true);
8389 }
8390#endif
8391
8392 // Geometric tolerance
8393 int hasCustomTolerance;
8394 utils::binary::read(stream, hasCustomTolerance);
8395 if (hasCustomTolerance) {
8396 double tolerance;
8397 utils::binary::read(stream, tolerance);
8398 setTol(tolerance);
8399 } else {
8400 resetTol();
8401 }
8402
8403 // Index generators
8404 bool hasVertexAutoIndexing;
8405 utils::binary::read(stream, hasVertexAutoIndexing);
8406 if (hasVertexAutoIndexing) {
8407 restoreVertexAutoIndexing(stream);
8408 } else {
8409 setVertexAutoIndexing(false);
8410 }
8411
8412 bool hasInterfaceAutoIndexing;
8413 utils::binary::read(stream, hasInterfaceAutoIndexing);
8414 if (hasInterfaceAutoIndexing) {
8415 restoreInterfaceAutoIndexing(stream);
8416 } else {
8417 setInterfaceAutoIndexing(false);
8418 }
8419
8420 bool hasCellAutoIndexing;
8421 utils::binary::read(stream, hasCellAutoIndexing);
8422 if (hasCellAutoIndexing) {
8423 restoreCellAutoIndexing(stream);
8424 } else {
8425 setCellAutoIndexing(false);
8426 }
8427}
8428
8435void PatchKernel::mergeAdaptionInfo(std::vector<adaption::Info> &&source, std::vector<adaption::Info> &destination)
8436{
8437 if (source.empty()) {
8438 return;
8439 } else if (destination.empty()) {
8440 destination.swap(source);
8441 return;
8442 }
8443
8444 throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to merge the adaption info.");
8445}
8446
8447}
